channel.title: Election 2008: The Way of Cain
channel.copyright: This work is licensed under a Creative Commons License - Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike - http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-sa/2.0/
channel.description:
Both Presidential candidiates profess faith in Jesus Christ.
However, do their opinions and policies betray the timeless tenents of their faith?
Can Americans vote by conscience, rather than on color, charisma and the promise of copious handouts? This Podcast was created using www.talkshoe.com
channel.itunes:author: Mary Diane Goin
channel.itunes:subtitle: Election 2008: The Way of Cain
channel.itunes:summary:
Both Presidential candidiates profess faith in Jesus Christ.
However, do their opinions and policies betray the timeless tenents of their faith?

channel.itunes:keywords: Obama McCain election president voting Biden Palin Christian compass conscience blessings America USA Cain

item.title: Election 2008: The Way of Cain
item.author: goinwell@nc.rr.com
item.description:
Both Presidential candidates profess a genuine faith in Christ, but do their ideas and policies betray that faith?
Who best (not perfectly) can lead this country in such a way as to invite the blessings of God?
Can Americans vote by conscience, rather than color, charisma or care packages?
item.itunes:author: Mary Diane Goin
item.itunes:subtitle: Election 2008: The Way of Cain
